questions.question: What is the capital city of Canada?
questions.fact: Ottawa was chosen as Canada’s capital in 1857 as a compromise between major cities.

questions.question: What is the capital of Australia?
questions.fact: Canberra was purpose-built to resolve rivalry between Sydney and Melbourne.

questions.question: What is the capital of Brazil?
questions.fact: Brasília became Brazil’s capital in 1960 to promote inland development.

questions.question: Which city is the capital of Japan?
questions.fact: Tokyo became Japan’s capital in 1868 during the Meiji Restoration.

questions.question: What is the capital of South Africa’s administrative branch?
questions.fact: South Africa uniquely has three capitals serving different government functions.

questions.question: Which river is traditionally considered the longest in the world?
questions.fact: The Nile stretches approximately 6,650 km through northeastern Africa.

questions.question: What is the tallest mountain above sea level?
questions.fact: Mount Everest rises 8,848 meters above sea level.

questions.question: Which desert is the largest in the world?
questions.fact: Deserts are defined by low precipitation, not temperature.

questions.question: Which ocean is the largest by surface area?
questions.fact: The Pacific Ocean covers more area than all land combined.

questions.question: What is the deepest known ocean trench?
questions.fact: Challenger Deep lies nearly 11,000 meters below sea level.

questions.question: Which continent is the driest inhabited continent?
questions.fact: Much of Australia’s interior consists of arid and semi-arid land.

questions.question: Which continent contains the most countries?
questions.fact: Africa has 54 internationally recognized countries.

questions.question: Which continent has no permanent human population?
questions.fact: Only scientists temporarily reside there for research.

questions.question: Which continent is home to the Amazon Rainforest?
questions.fact: The Amazon spans multiple countries but lies mostly in Brazil.

questions.question: Which continent is both a country and a continent?
questions.fact: Australia is the smallest continent by land area.

questions.question: Which country is landlocked?
questions.fact: Bolivia lost its coastline after the War of the Pacific.

questions.question: Which country shares the most borders with other countries?
questions.fact: China borders 14 countries.

questions.question: Which two countries share the longest international border?
questions.fact: The border spans about 8,891 km including water boundaries.

questions.question: Which European country is completely landlocked?
questions.fact: Austria is surrounded entirely by other European nations.

questions.question: Which country has no official capital?
questions.fact: Nauru operates without a designated capital city.

questions.question: Which sea lies between Greece and Turkey?
questions.fact: The Aegean Sea contains thousands of islands.

questions.question: Which sea is the saltiest major body of water?
questions.fact: Its high salinity allows people to float effortlessly.

questions.question: Which gulf lies between Iran and the Arabian Peninsula?
questions.fact: It is a critical global oil transport route.

questions.question: Which sea separates Europe and Africa?
questions.fact: It connects to the Atlantic via the Strait of Gibraltar.

questions.question: Which ocean surrounds Antarctica?
questions.fact: The Southern Ocean was officially recognized in 2000.

questions.question: Which biome is characterized by permafrost?
questions.fact: Permafrost remains frozen year-round.

questions.question: Which climate zone lies near the equator?
questions.fact: Tropical regions receive intense sunlight year-round.

questions.question: Which rainforest is the largest in the world?
questions.fact: The Amazon produces roughly 20% of Earth’s oxygen.

questions.question: What tectonic zone causes frequent earthquakes and volcanoes?
questions.fact: It surrounds the Pacific Ocean basin.

questions.question: Which biome dominates northern Canada?
questions.fact: The taiga is the world’s largest land biome.

questions.question: Which city has the highest population globally?
questions.fact: Tokyo’s metro area exceeds 37 million people.

questions.question: Which country has the highest population density?
questions.fact: Monaco has over 19,000 people per square kilometer.

questions.question: What term describes the movement of people from rural to urban areas?
questions.fact: Urbanization increases demand for housing and infrastructure.

questions.question: Which country has the largest population?
questions.fact: India surpassed China in population in 2023.

questions.question: Which city is known as a megacity?
questions.fact: Megacities have populations over 10 million.

questions.question: Which country has the most islands?
questions.fact: Sweden has over 267,000 islands.

questions.question: Which desert is NOT hot?
questions.fact: Cold deserts receive very little precipitation.

questions.question: Which country lies in both Europe and Asia?
questions.fact: The Bosporus Strait divides its continents.

questions.question: Which lake is the largest freshwater lake by surface area?
questions.fact: Lake Baikal is deepest, not largest by area.

questions.question: Which country technically has the longest coastline?
questions.fact: Canada’s irregular coastline stretches over 200,000 km.
